Summary Objective: Engineer systems & algorithms to help users get to the content they need. 
 
Summary: 
Hands-on experience with distributed systems for both online and offline data processing. 
 
Designed and implemented low-latency high-throughput online retrieval systems from scratch, doing micro and millisecond latencies for few hundred QPS per node (without caching). 
 
Designed and implemented simple & extensible data-infrastructure for offline data processing pipelines on hadoop. These range from simple search-index building pipelines, to non-trivial pipelines to do machine learning algorithms. Using tools like plain java map/reduce, pig, hive, spark, scalding and so forth (ordered by familiarity). 
 
Have delivered successful projects as part of a 1-man team, as a team member and in the capacity of a project lead. 
 
Extremely proficient in Java and JVM internals with a keen eye for performance, efficiency & software maintainability. Played with a bunch of other jvm languages like Scala, Groovy, Clojure, etc and the jvm memory/execution model. Experience Engineering LinkedIn November 2012  – Present (2 years 10 months) San Francisco Bay Area Currently part of the LinkedIn Content Engineering, focussing on SlideShare infrastructure (Tech Lead & IC for search/experimentation/offline workflows, helping with online java services effort etc). 
 
Earlier, as part of the Search team I worked on a wide range of infrastructure & relevance challenges. Some of which are: 
 
* One of the key players in rewriting the whole Search stack at LinkedIn. https://engineering.linkedin.com/search/did-you-mean-galene where I led the design & development of a generic Hadoop based Lucene indexing pipeline. Was also leading the people-search on galene project for a short while before changing teams 
 
* Led multi-colo efforts in Search 
 
* Designed and implemented a spellcheck service from scratch using best practices & novel techniques to correct query typos on people names – very different from an English dictionary based spellcheck 
 
* Recognized across the Search organization as the go-to guy for questions regarding java memory problems (and jvm in general), software design choices, performance optimization techniques, etc. Software Architect, Applied Research StumbleUpon November 2011  –  November 2012  (1 year 1 month) * Lead team, architect systems, design components, write code, review everyone’s code, deploy code to production, lookout for issues and fix. 
* These software components cover the entire spectrum: from backend distributed services written in Scala/Java that handle 10s of thousands of QPS per node to implementing machine learning algorithms efficiently on map/reduce  
* Helped team (7 engineers) scale their code by identifying bottlenecks and suggesting better ways to implement them 
* Architect & lead for the entire data pipeline used at StumbleUpon that identifies good urls 
* Designed and implemented url scoring for all urls in near-realtime latency 
* Reviewed all code from Applied Research group and responsible for the git repository containing all recommendations related code 
* Technologies: Scala, Java, PHP, C++, Memcache, Hadoop, HBase, Zookeeper, Oozie, Hive (hql, udf, streaming, etc), ElasticSearch, MySQL, protobuf, JSON, XML, Linux, zsh/bash, git, gerrit Senior Software Engineer, Applied Research StumbleUpon March 2011  –  November 2011  (9 months) Work on StumbleUpon's recommendation engine 
 
Software design and development. Implement recommendation algorithms on a distributed/large scale using hadoop, hbase, etc Research Engineer StumbleUpon June 2010  –  March 2011  (10 months) Helping users discover the web. 
 
Working on Recommender systems/recommendation engine used at StumbleUpon. Playing with data to link users and content. Also work on the ads related subcomponent.
